before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"a6b7s","text":"This protocol uses as input RNA extracted from nasopharyngeal swabs after confirmation of RSV infection via RT-PCR. Samples were extracted using the QIASymphony DSP Virus/Pathogen Midi Kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

creator.name: Carlos Davina-Nunez
creator.affiliation: Microbiology and Infectology Department, IIS Galicia Sur

affiliations.affiliation: Microbiology and Infectology Department, IIS Galicia Sur

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"91es2","text":"This protocol has been tested for amplification of RSV-positive nasopharyngeal swabs of CT value up to 24 using Seegene Allplex Respiratory Panel (Seegene Inc, Seoul, South Korea). This protocol does not require prior subtyping as it covers RSV-A and RSV-B in the same reaction. Panel of primers is an optimisation of a previously published panel by Wang et al. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7q9pd","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fontm","text":"This panel was modified to optimise the multiplex PCR, so the whole genome can be amplified in just two PCR reactions. In addition to this, primers have been modified to account for commonly-occurring mutations in the 22-23 season that affect primer-binding areas and were causing suboptimal amplification.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fg51","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"o25m","text":"These primers were used to cover the complete hRSV genome (both A and B) by splitting into two pools of non-consecutive amplicons (odd-numbered amplicon primers in one pool, even-numbered amplicon primers in other). This allowed for Whole-genome amplification in two reactions. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9k81h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6j24m","text":"Illumina CovidSeq (Illumina Inc, San Diego, USA) reagents were used for the RT-PCR, with a mix previously published for amplification of Influenza RNA and a thermocycling program optimised in our lab. The library preparation part of the protocol was performed according to the Illumina CovidSeq protocol.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Respiratory Syncytial Virus, RSV, NGS, Illumina, CovidSeq, amplification, PCR

references.title: A sequencing and subtyping protocol for Influenza A and B viruses using Illumina® COVIDSeq™ Assay Kit
references.authors: Ying Lin, Jeffrey Koble, Priyanka Prashar, Anita Pottekat, Christina Middle, Scott Kuersten, Michael Oberholzer, Robert Brazas, Darcy Whitlock, Robert Schlaberg, Gary P. Schroth

references.title: Next-generation sequencing of human respiratory syncytial virus subgroups A and B genomes.
references.authors: Wang L, Ng TFF, Castro CJ, Marine RL, Magaña LC, Esona M, Peret TCT, Thornburg NJ

references.title: Whole genome sequencing of respiratory syncytial (RSV) virus from clinical samples with low viral load
references.authors: Stephanie Goya, Gabriel L. Rojo, Mercedes S. Nabaes Jordar, Laura E. Valinotto, Alicia S Mistchenko, Mariana Viegas

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

{"blocks":[{"key":"f17df","text":"Two Master Mixes must be prepared per sample: one for Pool1 and one for Pool 2 (Table 2). Manipulate reagents according to the Illumina CovidSeq Reference Guide.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2t6p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ak4hn","text":" a PCR tube, mix 20 ul of MasterMix with 5 ul of extracted RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56o6d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etr1h","text":"Place steps.section: (OPTIONAL) Check RT-PCR result with Agilent Bioanalyzer
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5rgll","text":"Use an Agilent Bioanalyzer to check for amplification peaks. Expect PCR peaks around ~2000 bps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5i6je","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qlg2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e6ccr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kk71","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f6t35","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7be5o","text":" ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3ql42","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"2BF47CD0310311EEB9F97F8867A47656","height":397,"id":394308,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"8m7oa\",\"text\":\"RT-PCR result: peaks expected around 2000 bps. Representative image of an Agilent bioanalyzer of the amplification products. From left to right: ladder; RSV-A, pool 1; RSV-A, pool 2; RSV-B, pool 1; RSV-B, pool 2. Scale indicates size in base pairs. \",\"type\":\"align-justify\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":14},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":15,\"length\":32}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nbcgb6z8x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nbceb6z8x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nbcfb6z8x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/nbcdb6z8x.webp","width":550},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"image"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3nb6n","text":"Mix 10ul of tube one and tube two on each sample for a final 20 ul of PCR product. Follow instructions of the Illumina CovidSeq Reference Guide to generate sequencing-ready libraries.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpsv4","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8o43","text":"Recommended: To ensure optimal normalisation, perform the library Clean-up on each tube and normalise individually instead of pooling. This improves normalisation especially in the presence of low-concentration PCR products.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"37da5","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"640c6","text":"Quantify samples after Clean-up using Qubit Flex and normalise samples.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dkano","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6t8j6","text":"(OPTIONAL): Check library preparation on an Agilent Bioanalyzer. The pattern expected is the usual post-tagmentation pattern from Illumina libraries with the highest peak around ~330bps.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abfkh","text":"Average reads per sample (excluding negative control): 361k","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8280p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2utnc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"akkbi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffhqo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"result","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2cjnj","text":" ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"248560E4310411EEADC40A58A9FEAC02","height":"440","id":"2470DA70310411EEB9F97F8867A47656","is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"2ogla\",\"text\":\"Expected result after sequencing: All samples had a depth above 10 for more than 85% of the genome. Aditionally depth over 10 was reached for the full G protein and 98% of the F protein in all samples. \",\"type\":\"align-justify\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":33}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"fmn6o\",\"text\":\"\",\"type\":\"align-justify\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}},{\"key\":\"5qoko\",\"text\":\"The coverage of the negative control (Non-Template Control) appears in yellow after alignment to RSV-A reference (left) and RSV-B (right).\",\"type\":\"align-justify\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":null,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":null,"placeholder":"https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/FjwTBcX_2JHv13sPkhkt3o2DifOTneaG7w2xTRCkyQewtJDXo1AktipKlNhA7l5HBCJDfWaBxc_-gEVI2UduryGuiPAhbn0I6Y4JFLoTB06tIKDM4M5-pZ5xh_IymoKgnoE0yXfgFIX9b7gSc4aAHEM","shadow":false,"source":"https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/FjwTBcX_2JHv13sPkhkt3o2DifOTneaG7w2xTRCkyQewtJDXo1AktipKlNhA7l5HBCJDfWaBxc_-gEVI2UduryGuiPAhbn0I6Y4JFLoTB06tIKDM4M5-pZ5xh_IymoKgnoE0yXfgFIX9b7gSc4aAHEM","width":"602"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"image"}}}}}}
